page.title: 15POPULATION,CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: Brook Street. Most of the residents in this area have lived here all their lives and their parents before them. Apart from those living on farms about 50 houses and 130 people have their address "Brook Street", Cuckfield. This is not a street but a road 4 miles long from Whitemans Green to Balcombe. Formerly a country lane, now a busy thoroughfare affording access to Crawley and Gatwick Airport. The only industrial premises is a garage run by 3 brothers, grandsons of Mr. Smith who had a forge on this site before World War I. These brothers are all self- employed and as well as repairing cars and testing them for the M.O.T. certificate, they maintain farm machinery which can also be hired from them. They all live locally and would not wish to move.
